clinical_study.brief_title: A Study of BMS-986416 With and Without Nivolumab in Select Solid Tumors
clinical_study.official_title: A Phase 1 Study of BMS-986416 Alone and in Combination With Nivolumab in Select Solid Tumors

brief_summary.textblock: The purpose of this study is to evaluate the safety, tolerability, drug effects, drug levels and preliminary antitumor activity of BMS-986416 when administered alone and in combination with Nivolumab in participants with select advanced solid tumors.

primary_outcome.time_frame: Up to 100 days after the last treatment of study intervention(s)
Up to 100 days after the last treatment of study intervention(s)

primary_outcome.measure: Incidence of AEs meeting protocol-defined dose-limiting toxicity (DLT) criteria
primary_outcome.time_frame: Up to 100 days after the last treatment of study intervention(s)

primary_outcome.measure: Incidence of AEs leading to discontinuation
primary_outcome.time_frame: Up to 100 days after the last treatment of study intervention(s)

primary_outcome.measure: Incidence of AEs leading to death
primary_outcome.time_frame: Up to 100 days after the last treatment of study intervention(s)

primary_outcome.measure: Protocol-defined maximum tolerated dose (MTD) or maximum administered dose (MAAD)
primary_outcome.time_frame: Up to 100 days after the last treatment of study intervention(s)

secondary_outcome.measure: Maximum observed serum concentration (Cmax) of BMS-986416
secondary_outcome.time_frame: Up to 100 days after the last treatment of study intervention(s)

secondary_outcome.measure: Time of maximum observed serum concentration (Tmax) of BMS-986416
secondary_outcome.time_frame: Up to 100 days after the last treatment of study intervention(s)

secondary_outcome.measure: Trough observed serum concentration (Ctrough) of BMS-986416
secondary_outcome.time_frame: Up to 100 days after the last treatment of study intervention(s)

secondary_outcome.measure: Overall Response Rate (ORR) using Response Evaluation Criteria in Solid Tumors version 1.1 (RECIST 1.1) per Investigator assessment
Duration of Response (DOR) using RECIST 1.1 per Investigator assessment
Incidence of clinically significant changes in ECG parameters: QTcF
secondary_outcome.time_frame: Up to 100 days after the last treatment of study intervention(s)
secondary_outcome.description: QTcF = Corrected QT interval using the Fridericia formula. QT interval is the time from the start of the Q wave to the end of the T wave

criteria.textblock:
For more information regarding Bristol-Myers Squibb Clinical Trial participation, please visit:
www.BMSStudyConnect.com
Inclusion Criteria:
- Participants with histologically or cytologically confirmed locally advanced unresectable, metastatic, or recurrent select solid tumor
- Eligible tumor types Non-small cell lung cancer (NSCLC), Urothelial carcinoma (UC), Squamous cell carcinoma of the head and neck (SCCHN), Hepatocellular carcinoma (HCC), Microsatellite-stable colorectal carcinoma (MSS CRC), or Pancreatic ductal adenocarcinoma (PDAC)
- Resistant/refractory to or intolerant of existing standard therapies known to provide clinical benefit
- Measurable disease per Response Evaluation Criteria in Solid Tumors version 1.1 (RECIST v 1.1)
- Disease amenable to serial biopsy
Exclusion Criteria:
- Uncontrolled or significant cardiovascular disease
- Known connective tissue disease such as Marfan, Ehlers-Danlos, or Loeys-Dietz syndrome
- Medical requirement for chronic anticoagulant or antiplatelet agents (except low-dose aspirin, which is permitted)
Other protocol-defined inclusion/exclusion criteria apply
